event.title: was considered a rural area of the Province of Buenos Aires until 1888

data.event: Flores was considered a rural area of the Province of Buenos Aires until 1888 when it was integrated into the City.
Today, remains of those houses can still be found, including the house owned by Juan Manuel de Rosas, the Governor of the Province around the 19th century.
Purchasing property facing the new railway station (one of Argentina's first), they had a comfortable yet understated italianate property built in 1860.
Relocating in 1929, the family sold the property and the estate fell into disrepair.
Its fate now secure, as the home became the Marc√≥ del Pont Cultural Center.
